body: That check should be happening in the caller of this function (where it is possible for it to be the wrong type). Otherwise future users are going to write `fromBoolType(BoolType::get())` which is weird.
body_html: That check should be happening in the caller of this function (where it is possible for it to be the wrong type). Otherwise future users are going to write fromBoolType(BoolType::get()) which is weird.
body_text: That check should be happening in the caller of this function (where it is possible for it to be the wrong type). Otherwise future users are going to write fromBoolType(BoolType::get()) which is weird.
